Class SecurityConfiguration

java.lang.Object
autoberlo.autoberlo.config.SecurityConfiguration
@Configuration @EnableWebSecurity @EnableGlobalMethodSecurity(securedEnabled=true, prePostEnabled=true) public class SecurityConfiguration extends Object
Security configuration class that sets up authentication, authorization, and JWT-based security for the application.

This configuration class handles HTTP security, such as defining the rules for which users can access which endpoints, setting up JWT-based authentication, and managing session creation. It also configures password encoding using BCrypt.

Author:
Mandrusz Zsolt, Németh Marcell, Szász Kristóf

  • Constructor Details

    • SecurityConfiguration

      @Autowired public SecurityConfiguration(JwtAuthorizationFilter jwtAuthorizationFilter, JwtAccessDeniedHandler jwtAccessDeniedHandler, JwtAuthenticationEntryPoint jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint, @Qualifier("userDetailsService") org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService userDetailsService, org.springframework.security.crypto.bcrypt.BCryptPasswordEncoder passwordEncoder)
      Constructor to initialize necessary components for security configuration.
      Parameters:
      jwtAuthorizationFilter - the JWT authorization filter
      jwtAccessDeniedHandler - the handler for access denied exceptions
      jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint - the entry point for unauthorized access
      userDetailsService - the user details service for loading user data
      passwordEncoder - the password encoder for hashing passwords

    • getAuthenticationManager

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationManager getAuthenticationManager(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) throws Exception
      Bean definition for the AuthenticationManager.
      Parameters:
      http - the HttpSecurity object for building the authentication manager
      Returns:
      an instance of AuthenticationManager
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during authentication manager setup

    • filterChain

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.web.SecurityFilterChain filterChain(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) throws Exception
      Bean definition for the SecurityFilterChain. Configures security rules, JWT authentication filter, and session management.
      Parameters:
      http - the HttpSecurity object for configuring HTTP security
      Returns:
      an instance of SecurityFilterChain
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during HTTP security setup
